chapter.title: Queues
chapter.para: A GstQueue is a filter element. Queues can be used to link two elements in such way that the data can be buffered.

A buffer that is sinked to a Queue will not automatically be pushed to the next linked element but will be buffered. It will be pushed to the next element as soon as a gst_pad_pull () is called on the queue's source pad.

Queues are mostly used in conjunction with a GstThread to provide an external link for the thread elements. You could have one thread feeding buffers into a GstQueue and another thread repeadedly calling gst_pad_pull () on the queue to feed its internal elements.
